text.name: sys_description
text.text: Moonlight is an open-source version of NVIDIAs GameStream protocol that allows you to stream games from a PC equipped with an NVIDIA graphics card to a remote box. It is a game streaming software similar to 'Steam Link'. The project was born in 2013, and Batocera uses 'Moonlight Embedded' which also works on ARM devices like a Raspberry Pi. So you can stream your latest 3D games on your TV, even with a very weak box. The protocol supports up to 4 players, and 1080p 60fps.
